intro: Words starting with X are relatively incommon... but it's not unsual to find words ending with X. Don't worry, you can handle this quiz!

questions.ask: What did Jesus and Peter pay with a coin found in a fish's mouth?
What animal were the Israelites not to muzzle as it was treading grain?
What melting substance did the psalmist say his heart had turned to?
What metal tool miraculously floated for the prophet Elisha?
What Egyptian crop was destroyed by the plague of hail called down by Moses?

intro: According to the dictionary, xenophobia is a fear and hatred of foreigners - and something God actually encouraged to keep His chosen people pure. What do you know about these five cases?

questions.ask: What did the patriarch Isaac forbid his son Jacob to do with a Canaanite woman?
What annual ritual dinner of the Israelites were foreigners forbidden to eat?
What charge for borrowed money could Israelites apply to foreigners but not to fellow Jews?
What nationality, hated by the Jews, provided the "good guy" character in Jesus' parable of a man beaten by robbers?
What type of agreement did God forbid between Israel and the nations He would drive out of the Promised Land?

intro: He's also known as Ahasuerus... which is probably a good reason to go by "Xerxes". Tell us what you know about this ancient king.

questions.ask: What beautiful young Jewish woman was the second queen of the Persian King Xerxes?
What modern-day nation, with its capital at New Delhi, marked the eastern extent of King Xerxes's nation?
Who discovered and foiled a plot to assassinate King Xerxes?
What would King Xerxes hold out to show favor to the people who pleased him?
What city was the site of King Xerxes's royal citadel?

intro: Seeing through brick walls is a talent if the fictional Superman. But seeing through the walls of the heart is a power of the true God. What do you know about His "X-ray Vision"?

questions.ask: What son did King David tell, "The Lord searches every heart and understands every motive"?
What troublemaking religious leaders - accusing Jesus of casting out demons by the prince of demons had their thoughts read by Jesus?
What great prophet heard God say, "Man looks at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart"?
What did Jesus say God would do for the believers He sees secretly giving to the needy?
What "el"oquent friend of Job proclaimed God's complete knowledge, saying, "There is no dark place... where evildoers can hide"?
